page.title: 08REDMARLEY 50 YEARS AGO TWO
page.content: Church House,the old work house,was then the Post Office. The Postmen and women delivered all the letters on bicycles. Stamps cost 0.5d (0.2p) for a card and 1d (0.4p) for a letter. There were two posts a day and letters were delivered within 24hrs. We had a local policeman who was seen cycling around most days. Everyone had great respect for the Squire,Rector, School Master and Police. The roads were much safer as traffic was much slower. There were still a few people using horses and traps, even to go to Church. There was a service every day in Church.The Church and the Village Hall were heated by coke stoves and were always lovely and warm. There were no council houses. Where the school now stands was a field with a pond.
